column5: Anyone had good results with any operators for lakers or Whities on Simcoe? A group of guys I go with every year is looking for a new one.
It's been a long time, but I was always partial to Floyd Hales out of Beaverton!

http://fishhutrentals.com/Home ^^^What he said^^^  GREAT operator.  We did our annual company trip with him a couple weeks ago. Don and his dad went way beyond the norm to make sure everyone was comfortable,  and I've been out a couple other times with him on my own.  I have my own hut in a different part of the lake, but its nice to fish different water from time to time.  Best part is he's on fish...
I usually stick with Tim Hales. He's a great guy. There are some shady operators on simcoe IMO, but Timmy has been running for a long time, and has the best equipment on the lake IMO.  S.

I usually stick with Tim Hales. He's a great guy. There are some shady operators on simcoe IMO, but Timmy has been running for a long time, and has the best equipment on the lake IMO.  S.  Ya they seem to popping up like flies.  Back in the day,we fished out of Chubbs. Not sure they are around any more. East side of the lake. Fished out of Hanks after that.  Since then,I have done the wild open.  MOVE MOVE MOVE.
I think they all decided to book with Floyd Hales. Hopefully it will have a whitie or laker report end of Feb.
